# How it works:
# Each texture definition starts with the name and a number of light "hotspots"
# An optional extra parameter can be used to specify a type in case there's
# some conflicting name dickery (e.g. a flat and a wall texture with same name)
# in which case you'd add T or F after the name
# Each hotspot can have either 6 or 8 parameters
# The parameters are x and y positions in the texture, then a rgb color, and
# a radius. If the other two parameters are given, then this hotspot is
# turned into a spotlight, and they become the inner/outer angles
# Spotlights are automatically oriented to face away from the surface
#



bigbrik3 2
16 124 90 76 11 128
48 124 90 76 11 128


bigdoor1 1
64 36 16 24 128 32


bricklit 1
32 32 90 76 22 200


bronze4 2
16 124 90 76 11 128
48 124 90 76 11 128

32 32 90 76 22 200

32 32 77 66 44 80 30 60
